results.title: Using lenses. Part 1. The lens turret
results.creator_credit: Mavis Lock and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a typical four-lens turret for the television camera, and how these lenses are used in different angles in television production without change of camera position.

results.title: Using equivalent fractions to compute sums
results.brief_description: Fraction County, so named because of the Fraction surnames given to each family, found it had families that could not live together happily. The problem was solved when the families realized they had something in common: equivalent fractions get along together. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Using analytical tools
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Text-Films and University of Minnesota
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”
Illustrates how a trained student counsellor prepared for his interview with an average 16-year-old boy. Discusses the value of analytical tools - such as the student’s cumularive record, his aptitude tests, his anecdotal record and his auto-biography - in identifying and analysing problems.

results.title: Use your head
results.brief_description: In this video, Tony Buzan explains how to acquire skills needed in any successful business - effective learning, creative thinking and problem solving. He introduces the key concept of mind mapping and explains how reading power and memory can be improved.

results.title: Use and reuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conserving Our Environment”
How does a living organism relate to its environment? Dean learns about the ecological systems of the earth as he observes the ecological system of a fishbowl. He discovers how humans relate to their environment - how we use it, destroy it and restore it.
